p: Moreover, these differences in the chemical composition may explain the differences in the antimicrobial activities. In fact, our T. bovei showed higher activity than the corresponding Turkish species, which were 0.5 and 31.25 for Escherichia coli, and 0.25 and 31.25 for Candida albicans respectively, which means that our studied species had more powerful antibacterial activity against studied microbial species than the Turkish Thymus species [ 20].
